div.bibl: A. E. Strand, History of Norwegians of Illinois. John Anderson Publishing Co., Chicago, Ill., 1905, p.182

body.p: Halstein Thorsteinson worked as gardener for Walter L. Newberry when he first came to Chicago.
The Norwegians got Jenny Lind to contribute $1,000 to build the Episcopalian church on Franklin Street, near Michigan.
The first Norwegian to enter public life was Iver Lawson, the father of Victor Lawson, publisher of Daily News.
The Norwegians became wealthy through increase in value of their farm land.
